content:
• Wednesday, November 23, 2011
  • PRTK

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) has resumed trading, and is now up 17.6% in the wake of the...

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) has resumed trading, and is now up 17.6% in the wake of the FDA's approval of its Intermezzo insomnia drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • SHW

    Coatings company Valspar (VAL -2.6%) dips after JP Morgan cuts the shares to Overweight on...

    Coatings company Valspar (VAL -2.6%) dips after JP Morgan cuts the shares to Overweight on valuation. The firm says the stock has gotten away from the pack after appreciating 25% since last August, versus a comparable 1% rise in the S&P 500.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • DMND

    More on Diamond Foods (DMND -18.6%): A Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) spokesman says the company...

    More on Diamond Foods (DMND -18.6%): A Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) spokesman says the company is still committed to completing the Pringles deal in the second half of its fiscal year (ends in June) ... though that still leaves room for the deal's terms to be changed. Deutsche thinks the deal has a 20% chance of collapsing, while RiverPoint Capital's Leon Lowensteine puts the odds at 50%. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 9 Comments

  • Comverse Technology (CMVT +1.4%) jumps after Reuters reports the company has "received potential...

    Comverse Technology (CMVT +1.4%) jumps after Reuters reports the company has "received potential interest" in its telecom billing software business, which accounts for nearly half of its revenue. Activist shareholder Cadian Capital has been pushing for the division's sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • DMND

    The crash in Diamond Foods (DMND -20.5%) that's followed the suicide of a director who recused...

    The crash in Diamond Foods (DMND -20.5%) that's followed the suicide of a director who recused himself from an accounting investigation has gone from bad to worse. Analyst Louis Meyer thinks Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) will now think twice about accepting Diamond shares as part of its Pringles sale, which in turn could force Diamond to assume more debt to complete the deal. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • JWN

    Retail shares fall just days before Black Friday, as weak consumer spending data puts the kabosh...

    Retail shares fall just days before Black Friday, as weak consumer spending data puts the kabosh on optimism for a holiday spending spree: Nordstrom (JWN -1.9%), Target (TGT -1.9%), Best Buy (BBY -1.8%) and Macy's (M -2.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • SIX

    Six Flags Entertainment (SIX +0.5%) trades up after the theme park operator announces plans to...

    Six Flags Entertainment (SIX +0.5%) trades up after the theme park operator announces plans to refinance its current credit facilities with the goal of negotiating new loans and lines of credit by mid-December 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • NUAN

    Nuance (NUAN -0.2%) is outperforming after beating FQ4 estimates, and guiding in prepared...

    Nuance (NUAN -0.2%) is outperforming after beating FQ4 estimates, and guiding in prepared remarks (.pdf) for FY12 revenue of $1.66B-$1.71B ($1.61B consensus) and EPS of $1.55-$1.62 ($1.60 consensus). Deutsche is pleased with the rebound in Nuance's enterprise business, while Canaccord thinks Apple's Siri, which is believed to use Nuance's software, will compel rivals to develop similar services.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • PRTK

    Shares of Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT +1.2%) remain halted after the company receives FDA...

    Shares of Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT +1.2%) remain halted after the company receives FDA approval for its insomnia treatment Intermezzo earlier than anticipated.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • GOLD

    Gold stocks are weak today on softness in the yellow metal futures, as a failed German bond...

    Gold stocks are weak today on softness in the yellow metal futures, as a failed German bond auction sends investors scrambling for the safety of cash and U.S. bonds: Randgold (GOLD -3%), Barrick Gold (ABX -1.8%), NovaGold (NG -3.5%), Kinross (KGC -1.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • RENN

    Renren (RENN -7%) makes new 52-week lows after Pac Crest's Evan Wilson downgrades shares to...

    Renren (RENN -7%) makes new 52-week lows after Pac Crest's Evan Wilson downgrades shares to Sector Perform, and forecasts below-consensus 2012 revenue and EPS. Wilson is worried about competition from Sina's (NASDAQ:SINA) Weibo and Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY), and also about a lack of differentiation among Chinese social networking sites. Renren is now down 74% from its May IPO price. (Q3 results)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • RRM

    RRSat Global Communications (RRST +2.1%) trades up after appointing Itzhak Zion as the company's...

    RRSat Global Communications (RRST +2.1%) trades up after appointing Itzhak Zion as the company's new CFO, effective Dec. 1. Mr. Zion will replace current CFO David Aber, who is resigning.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +1.8%) gains after saying it's signed an exclusive agreement for the...

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +1.8%) gains after saying it's signed an exclusive agreement for the registration and marketing of perifosine in the Middle East and North Africa with Hikma Pharmaceuticals (OTCPK:HKMPY).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • MHS

    Express Scripts (ESRX +1.9%) and Medco Health (MHS +1.2%) are joining Walgreen (WAG +5.2%) in...

    Express Scripts (ESRX +1.9%) and Medco Health (MHS +1.2%) are joining Walgreen (WAG +5.2%) in spiking higher on the rumor that Walgreen and Express Scripts will come to terms on a new prescription-claims deal. CVS (CVS -1.1%) has sold off slightly.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • BZH

    Beazer Homes (BZH +2.1%) spikes higher after it's disclosed director and ex-CEO Brian Beazer...

    Beazer Homes (BZH +2.1%) spikes higher after it's disclosed director and ex-CEO Brian Beazer bought 13K shares at prices at or near $2.03.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • EGI

    Entree Gold (EGI -21.7%) dives in afternoon trading after announcing plans to issue C$12.5M in...

    Entree Gold (EGI -21.7%) dives in afternoon trading after announcing plans to issue C$12.5M in shares, which the company says it will use to "fund ongoing exploration" for mining projects in Nevada and Mongolia.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • WBA

    Walgreens (WAG +7.2%) pops on rumors of a settlement with Express Scripts (ESRX +2.4%)

    Walgreens (WAG +7.2%) pops on rumors of a settlement with Express Scripts (ESRX +2.4%)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • DSX

    Dry bulk shipper Diana Shipping (DSX -3.6%) sinks after its Q3 beat Street estimates, but...

    Dry bulk shipper Diana Shipping (DSX -3.6%) sinks after its Q3 beat Street estimates, but declined on a Y/Y basis. Time charter revenues also fell, coming in at $64M compared to $72M a year ago, mainly due to lower average rates and a deconsolidation its container ship fleet. Separately, the company announces a $100M stock buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • P

    IPO underwriters JPMorgan and Morgan Stanley remain bullish on Pandora (P -6.5%) following its...

    IPO underwriters JPMorgan and Morgan Stanley remain bullish on Pandora (P -6.5%) following its FQ3 report, citing strong growth in listener hours and improved mobile monetization. But shares are still selling off, partly thanks to a soft FQ4 EPS forecast. Pandora's attempts to grow its profits remain handicapped by its massive royalty payments to music studios, which grow in proportion to listener hours.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -4.3%) slips after Macquarie cuts the shares to Neutral on valuation....

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -4.3%) slips after Macquarie cuts the shares to Neutral on valuation. Separately, the company announces the closing of its 48.3M share secondary offering at $7.75 per share, a 3% discount to yesterday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • JNY

    Jones Apparel (JNY -4.4%) trades lower after Lazard cut the shares to Neutral from Buy, citing...

    Jones Apparel (JNY -4.4%) trades lower after Lazard cut the shares to Neutral from Buy, citing topline pressure due to a worsening economic environment. The company has been focusing on its retail business - which has not been profitable since 2006 - and, despite all of its efforts, the challenging wholesale environment and macro backdrop make a turnaround over the near-term unlikely.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Sean Egan fires back at Oppenheimer's defense of Jefferies (JEF +6.4%), pointing out even the...

    Sean Egan fires back at Oppenheimer's defense of Jefferies (JEF +6.4%), pointing out even the recommended deleveraging would reduce the debt/capital ratio from 90% to 86%, still way higher than competitors like Interactive Brokers (IEX:IBKR) at 67%. Goldman (NYSE:GS) and Morgan (NYSE:MS) can sport higher ratios because their size and bank charters give them a government backstop.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • STP

    Suntech (STP -3.8%) dips after Maxim Group reiterates its sell on the stock. Maxim says despite...

    Suntech (STP -3.8%) dips after Maxim Group reiterates its sell on the stock. Maxim says despite the company outpacing its peers in the recent quarter, it's unlikely to repeat the feat, and yesterday's 17% jump was largely due to a short squeeze. Additionally, Jefferies cuts its price target on the shares due to concerns over pending write-offs and potential consolidation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • MODL

    Medquist Holdings (OTCPK:MEDH -3.3%) dips after announcing it's acquired privately-held Poiesis...

    Medquist Holdings (OTCPK:MEDH -3.3%) dips after announcing it's acquired privately-held Poiesis Informatics, a healthcare IT workflow solutions developer. Financial terms were not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • HTCCF

    While tech in general is selling off, wireless chipmakers are getting hit harder than most,...

    While tech in general is selling off, wireless chipmakers are getting hit harder than most, after HTC's (OTC:HTCCF) Q4 bombshell raises fears of a slowdown in smartphone demand. QCOM -3.8%. BRCM -3.1%. OVTI -3%. CRUS -4.2%. MRVL -3.9%. SWKS -6.7%. TQNT -3.8%. RFMD -4.1%. ANAD -5.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • MTOR

    Auto parts maker Meritor (MTOR -5%) has had a rough month, losing over 50% of its value since...

    Auto parts maker Meritor (MTOR -5%) has had a rough month, losing over 50% of its value since the end of October. Citigroup asks whether it's time for the company to reconsider its options, as the stock's capitulation seems like a vote of no confidence in its retooling efforts. A merger with American Axle & Manufacturing (AXL -1.9%) could be the best option.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • RDN

    Radian (RDN -7.1%) gets slammed by a Moody's downgrade of its credit rating late yesterday,...

    Radian (RDN -7.1%) gets slammed by a Moody's downgrade of its credit rating late yesterday, citing the company's weak credit profile and ongoing stress on the firms capital and liquidity position due to mortgage market weakness.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy (YGE +9.3%) takes off after delivering a Q3 report that wasn't as bad as...

    Yingli Green Energy (YGE +9.3%) takes off after delivering a Q3 report that wasn't as bad as feared by investors accustomed to assuming the worst for solar names. Revenue of $667.8M (+36% Y/Y) beat by $8.2M, but EPS of -$0.14 missed by $0.12. Gross margin fell 1130 bps Q/Q to 10.8%. In addition, Yingli is now guiding for 2011 module shipments of 1.58GW-1.63GW, below prior guidance of 1.7GW-1.75GW.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • XPER

    Tessera Technologies (TSRA +3.98%) gets a lift in a weak tape after Hynix Semiconductor renews...

    Tessera Technologies (TSRA +3.98%) gets a lift in a weak tape after Hynix Semiconductor renews its license agreement with the company, extending it to May, 2017.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -3.4%) scrapes up against its 52-week low of $5.13 in line with a general...

    Bank of America (BAC -3.4%) scrapes up against its 52-week low of $5.13 in line with a general selloff, but also suffering from the new round of stress tests announced by the Fed. The seemingly tough exam could force BofA into a large capital raise at just the time its stock price won't allow it (Soros' reflexivity comes to mind).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (SQNM -5.3%) sells off after filing for a $150M mixed shelf offering consisting of...

    Sequenom (SQNM -5.3%) sells off after filing for a $150M mixed shelf offering consisting of common stock, preferred stock, debt, and warrants. The maker of DNA analysis products says it plans to use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 2 Comments
  • DE

    Deere (DE +3.7%) trades higher after its FQ4 results easily beat estimates earlier today. Net...

    Deere (DE +3.7%) trades higher after its FQ4 results easily beat estimates earlier today. Net income jumped 46% Y/Y on an 18% rise in revenue. The company says prices for farm crops will remain strong into next year, driving higher farm machinery sales and prompting the company to raise its FY12 forecast. It now expects total cash receipts from U.S. farming - a key driver for machinery sales - to be $374B in 2012, up from its August view of $362B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • VALE

    The real is tumbling (BZF -2.1%) - a natural as risk moves to "off" - but also reflecting...

    The real is tumbling (BZF -2.1%) - a natural as risk moves to "off" - but also reflecting Brazil's reliance China, whose economic slowdown looks to be accelerating. An excellent proxy for Brazil, China, and the whole emerging growth story is VALE, -4.3% today, 34% YTD, selling for 5X earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • BIG

    Big Lots (BIG -5.8%) dips after Barclays cuts the shares to Equalweight on valuation, noting...

    Big Lots (BIG -5.8%) dips after Barclays cuts the shares to Equalweight on valuation, noting concerns over a potentially weak holiday season.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • CUB

    Cubic (CUB -6.3%) trades lower after JP Morgan cuts its rating to Neutral on the back of its...

    Cubic (CUB -6.3%) trades lower after JP Morgan cuts its rating to Neutral on the back of its mixed FQ4 results, citing a lack of catalysts in transportation and uncertainty in its defense-related business.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • RFP

    AbitibiBowater (ABH -5.8%) takes a hit this morning after RBC cuts the stock to Sector Perform....

    AbitibiBowater (ABH -5.8%) takes a hit this morning after RBC cuts the stock to Sector Perform. The firm cites concern over "growing economic uncertainty" in North America and the negative impact it will have on groundwood paper and newsprint demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -7.3%) opens ugly, now trading at $18.60, well below the $20 offering price. The...

    Groupon (GRPN -7.3%) opens ugly, now trading at $18.60, well below the $20 offering price. The shares are off about 35% from their opening trades in the $30 range following the IPO less than 3 weeks ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) +6.4% after saying late yesterday that its key "Promus Element"...

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) +6.4% after saying late yesterday that its key "Promus Element" heart stent has gained FDA approval. The product will replace the Promus stent that Boston now co-markets with Abbott Labs (ABT -0.7%) , which had received 40% of the profit until now.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • BSX

    Premarket gainers: BSX +7%. DE +6%. AEZS +5%.Losers: DMND -12%. FRO -7%. MT -4%. RCL -4%. ALU...

    Premarket gainers: BSX +7%. DE +6%. AEZS +5%.
    Losers: DMND -12%. FRO -7%. MT -4%. RCL -4%. ALU -4%. UN -3%. RIO -3%. TEF -3%. BHP -3%. LEN -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM

  • Could Germany change its mind over how to deal with the eurozone's debt crisis after a rise in...

    Could Germany change its mind over how to deal with the eurozone's debt crisis after a rise in yields today? David Beers, the head of S&P's sovereign ratings, seems to think so. "It's quite telling that there has been upward pressure on yields in Germany - it might begin to change perceptions," said Beers.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM | 3 Comments
  • DMND

    Jefferies opines on the suicide of Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) director Joseph Silveira and the...

    Jefferies opines on the suicide of Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) director Joseph Silveira and the plunge AH in the company's shares amidst an accounting investigation, saying investors should not jump to conclusions. "We do not think there is necessarily a link between the two." The firm sees a worst case value for the stock of $39. Premarket, shares are at $30.75, -12%.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM | 5 Comments
  • NOK

    Announcing plans to slash operating expenses by $1B, Nokia Siemens Networks (NOK, SI) says it...

    Announcing plans to slash operating expenses by $1B, Nokia Siemens Networks (NOK, SI) says it will cull 17K jobs from its global workforce by 2013's end. Company strategy is to be reoriented to focus on "the future of our industry" - mobile broadband and services. Nokia +2.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 AM

  • German Bund futures fall as much as 69 ticks to a session low of 136.56 after the country's...

    German Bund futures fall as much as 69 ticks to a session low of 136.56 after the country's disastrous bond auction. The euro also drops, -0.9% for the day at $1.339. EU shares take a dive as well, with the Euro STOXX 50 -0.9%, London -0.9%, Paris -0.6%, Frankfurt -1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 AM

  • Surprisingly bad Chinese PMI data and speculation that Dexia's bailout could collapse have sent...

    Surprisingly bad Chinese PMI data and speculation that Dexia's bailout could collapse have sent EU shares lower in early trading, with miners and banks hit. Europe 600 Basic Resources Index -1.1%, Europe 600 Banks index -0.5%, Euro STOXX 50 -0.5%, London -0.5%, Paris -0.5%, Frankfurt -0.3%, Milan -0.3%, Madrid -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 AM
